name: git-persona
description: Enforce per-repo git user.name and user.email before you work.

commands.title: Git Persona: Open Workspace Identity Settings
Git Persona: Fix Active Repository Identity

gitPersona.enabled.description: Enable identity checks when opening repositories.

gitPersona.blockUntilConfigured.description: When true, keep prompting until identity is configured for each repository.

gitPersona.autoApplyBestMatch.description: When true, auto-apply the best matching identity preset when identity is missing or invalid.

gitPersona.statusBarEnabled.description: Show current repository identity status in the status bar.

gitPersona.checkIntervalMs.description: If > 0, periodically re-check repository identities at this interval in milliseconds.

gitPersona.maxRecentIdentities.description: Maximum number of recently used identities to remember in workspace settings.

gitPersona.allowedDomains.description: Optional email domain allow-list (for example: company.com). Empty means any domain.

gitPersona.ignoredRepositories.description: Absolute repository paths ignored by Git Persona checks.

label.description: Optional display label for this identity preset.

match.description: Optional match string or list. If it appears in repo path/name/remote URL, this preset can be auto-selected.

gitPersona.identities.description: Identity presets shown when configuring a repository. Example: [{"label":"Work","name":"Jane Dev","email":"jane@company.com","match":["github.com/work-org","/work/"]}].

gitPersona.recentIdentities.description: Automatically maintained list of recently used identities.
